citation.article-title: Camelimonas lactis gen. nov., sp. nov., isolated from the milk of camels
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Camelimonas lactis sp. nov.
Camelimonas lactis (lac′tis. L. gen. n. lactis from milk, referring to milk as the isolation source of the first reported strains).
Cell and colony morphology and growth characteristics are as given in the genus description.
Growth is detected on TSA at 15–37 °C.
No growth is observed at 10 or 45 °C.
Growth is observed in TS broth at pH 5.5–10.5.
In addition to Q-10, minor amounts of Q-8 and Q-9 and traces of Q-11 are detected.
In addition to the polar lipids listed in the genus description, minor amounts of three unidentified polar lipids and a third aminolipid are detectable.
Putrescine is detectable in minor to moderate amounts.

Utilizes the following carbon sources: d-glucose, acetate, propionate, adipate, 4-aminobutyrate, azelate, fumarate, glutarate, dl-3-hydroxybutyrate, itaconate, dl-lactate, mesaconate, oxoglutarate, l-alanine and l-aspartate.

Does not utilize N-acetyl-d-galactosamine, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, l-arabinose, d-fructose, d-galactose, gluconate, d-mannose, maltose, melibiose, l-rhamnose, d-ribose, salicin, sucrose, trehalose, d-xylose, adonitol, inositol, maltitol, d-mannitol, d-sorbitol, cis- or trans-aconitate, putrescine, β-alanine, d-histidine, l-leucine, l-ornithine, l-phenylalanine, l-tryptophan, 3-hydroxybenzoate or 4-hydroxybenzate.

Hydrolyses aesculin and l-alanine p-nitroanilide (pNA) and does not hydrolyse o-nitrophenyl β-d-galactopyranoside, p-nitrophenyl (pNP) β-d-glucuronide, pNP α-d-glucopyranoside, pNP β-d-glucopyranoside, pNP β-d-xyloside, 2-deoxythymidine-5′-pNP phosphate or l-glutamate-γ-3-carboxy pNA.
Further details of carbon source utilization and hydrolysis of chromogenic substrates (including differentiating characters from Chelatococcus species) are indicated in Table 2.
The type strain, M 2040T (=CCUG 58638T =CCM 7696T), was isolated from milk of a camel.
Other strains of this species are M 1973 and M 1878-SK2.
